intro: Lepidaploa cuiabensis, commonly known as the Cuiabá lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
